Posts.Content: It's 3 weeks since my law chemo, some of my toenails ate really sore (or the skin below/surrounding them). Was going to redo toe polish and they look disgusting.  My big toenails have gone dark brown and really thick. I'm not sure if there's anything I can do about the discomfort/if it's normal or not. I won't be at Oncology for a while and Radiotherapy starts on Wednesday.  I'm unsure if it's chemo related (pacletaxo) or I have a fungul nail that will need treatment. Thanks
Posts.Title: Toenails - Yuck!

Posts.Content: I've sort of cut my nails after soaking and have a 90 minute foot mask on as I type, having pumiced my feet. I was out last night and couldn't wear any 'going out' shoes or boots as it was too uncomfortable. It does look like one of them is coming away a bit. I've been moisturising my feet as the nurse said that was the only thing I could do to protect my toenails.  I won't put any more polish on, even though it's how I've been trying to hide it.  Didn't realise radiotherapy could also affect nails.  Thanks for the replies
Posts.Title: Toenails - Yuck!

Posts.Content: I had my second of 9 weekly pacletaxol yesterday. Got curious and wondered what the blood results meant in my chemo book. I notice that 'neuts' are a lot lower since I first had fec chemo back in April. I'm desperate to get chemo over and with all the delays due to recurrent uti's I don't want that happening again. Neuts are down to 1.8. I did a wee search about and found that apparently Manuka honey will increase neuts. Has anyone tried this/found it worthwhile? Also, due to delays/surgery I'm now sporting a fairly  thick (albeit short) white head of hair. The colour is horrific however I'm pleased with the regrowth (btw I used Nioxin shampoo etc and would recommend it). I've been told my hair may go and it will go by 2 different oncologists. Sounds silly but even hanging on to this bit of hair would feel like a small victory. Thanks once again in advance for any help
Posts.Title: Neuts/Pacletaxo and hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi Cranberry juice doesn't help, nor did antibiotics. Eventually it did go and I now take  daily antibiotic as prevention. I will look at diet Re type of honey I was going to get 20+ from Holland and Barrett, I assume they're reputable. Thanks Mandy
Posts.Title: Neuts/Pacletaxo and hair loss

Posts.Content: Just finished Fec on Friday, start t in 3 weeks and was wondering when my eyelashes would go. Bit of a relief that they might not. That said I wish my beard and moustache would go and they've not either! Also still have a little bit of leg hair growth and some hair on my head!  Unsure if it would be ok to wax tache as i normally would Congrats to all the ladies and any kind of victory!
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Hi all Was told by BCN to wait 6 months before hair dye. I am scunnered with white hair and still wearing hats!! Has anyone tried the vegetable dye from Holland and Barrett that apparently colours grey and lasts for 10 washes? Desperate to ditch the hats but can't with this white hair Any advice most appreciated!
Posts.Title: Hair Colour

Posts.Content: Thanks, I will:) Strand test first! Grey may be trendy but every time I look in the mirror I see my Gran and it's not a look I'm keen on. I just want to feel more like the old me:)
Posts.Title: Hair Colour

Posts.Content: I start herceptin for a year on my next chemo. Don't know what to expect. Is it that bad?
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: Should've said, last chemo was on 16 December
